H0.text: Hydrophobic molecules are the kinds of molecules that hydrophilic molecules generally avoid.

H1.text: Aqueous molecules are the kind of molecules that hydrophilic molecules generally avoid.

H2.text: Lipophilic molecules are generally avoided by hydrophilic molecules.

H3.text: Neutral molecules are the other kinds of molecules that hydrophilic molecules generally avoid.

A4.text: The hydrophobic effect is the observed tendency of nonpolar substances to aggregate in an aqueous solution and to be excluded by water.

A5.text: The hydrophobic effect is responsible for the separation of a mixture of oil and water into its two components.
